claim.text: Combining tabular data with text transcripts and audio recordings improves stock volatility and price movement prediction by 5-12%
claim.exact_quote: combining tabular data from financial semi-structured documents with text transcripts and audio recordings not only improves stock volatility and price movement prediction by 5-12%

evidence.evidence_text: M3ANet + DocEmbedding achieves better MSE and F1 scores compared to baseline M3ANet across all time intervals
evidence.limitations: Limited to two specific datasets and one architecture
evidence.exact_quote: Adding DocEmbedding outperforms base methods across all tasks and intervals

evidence.evidence_text: Improvement shown across multiple baseline models on earnings calls dataset
evidence.limitations: Only volatility prediction evaluated for earnings calls
evidence.exact_quote: Our approach of augmenting with DocEmbeddings outperform corresponding base methods across 3,7,15-day intervals

evaluation.justification: Consistent improvements shown across multiple models and datasets with statistical significance tests
evaluation.key_limitations: Limited to specific US market datasets and time periods

claim.text: Using tabular data reduces gender bias in audio-based neural networks by over 30%
claim.exact_quote: reduces gender bias caused due to audio-based neural networks by over 30%

evidence.evidence_text: Error disparity metrics across modalities showing lower bias with tabular data
evidence.limitations: Only evaluated on M3A model, limited demographic representation
evidence.exact_quote: We show that tabular information can substitute audio input to reduce gender bias in multimodal financial prediction tasks
only 7% in earnings calls and 12% in M&A calls identify as females

evaluation.justification: Clear evidence of bias reduction but limited by dataset representation
evaluation.key_limitations: Binary gender assumption, limited demographic diversity

claim.text: Using tabular data instead of audio maintains model performance while reducing processing requirements
claim.exact_quote: Replacing audio clips with tabular data from company filings leads to a reduction of data processing time and data storage requirements by over 90% and 50%

evidence.exact_quote: substituting company filings instead of its audio counterpart inconjunction with text transcripts does not significantly deteriorate model performance

evaluation.justification: Performance claims well supported but efficiency claims lack detailed metrics
